title: BPSC exam row: ‘Vanity van’ near Prashant Kishor’s protest site in Patna sparks controversy - The Hindu
summary:
Controversy Over 'Vanity Van' at Prashant Kishor’s Protest in Patna

Published Date: January 04, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Controversy erupted on January 4, 2025, over a 'vanity van' parked near the protest site of Prashant Kishor in Patna, where he is conducting a hunger strike over allegations of a questioned paper leak in the BPSC exam.

  • The vanity van, equipped with luxury facilities, raised eyebrows as it was located close to Gandhi Maidan, where Kishor's protest commenced on January 2, 2025.
  • Kishor highlighted the discrepancy between his protest and the lavish amenities, questioning the significance of restroom facilities compared to the future of BPSC aspirants.
  • A legal protest notice was issued by the district administration claiming the gathering was illegal as per a High Court order.
  • Over the last three weeks, several demonstrators have been actively advocating for a cancellation of the examination.
“I want to convey this through mediapersons... let this van be taken away and in return, give me ₹25 lakh per day and provide an alternate space that can be used as a washroom.” - Prashant Kishor

The situation surrounding Mr. Kishor's protest continues to be contentious, with authorities warning of actions against him and his supporters.
newTitle: Controversy Over 'Vanity Van' at Prashant Kishor’s Protest in Patna

Wife, her mother and brother get bail in case of abetting Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's suicide - NDTV
summary:
Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

Date: Today | Source: Bengaluru Court

The wife and in-laws of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash have been granted bail by a Bengaluru court in the abetment of suicide case against them following Subhash's suicide on December 9.

  • Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania and her family were accused of harassment leading to his death.
  • They had previously appealed to the Karnataka High Court for expedited bail proceedings.
  • Subhash left a video and a detailed note accusing his wife and her relatives of torturing him.
  • Nikita was arrested in Gurugram; her family members were arrested in Prayagraj.
  • The parents of Subhash are seeking custody of their grandson.
“My son was broken from inside... His suicide note mentioned that his parents be given custody of his child,” said Pawan Kumar, Subhash's father.

This case raises serious concerns about marital harassment and the mental health of individuals facing familial pressures.
newTitle: Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

title: Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Wife, In-Laws Get Bail In Abetment Of Suicide Case - NDTV
summary:
Bengaluru Court Grants Bail to Atul Subhash's Wife and In-Laws in Suicide Case

Publication Date: Today Source: Local News

The wife and in-laws of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash have been granted bail by a Bengaluru court in an abetment of suicide case.

  • Atul Subhash died by suicide on December 9, citing harassment from his wife and her family.
  • His wife Nikita, her mother Nisha, and brother Anurag were granted bail after an appeal to the session court.
  • On December 14, the wife and in-laws were arrested in connection with the case.
  • Subhash left behind a video and note detailing harassment, extortion, and allegations against his wife and her relatives.
  • His parents are seeking custody of their four-year-old grandson, expressing concerns for his welfare.
“My son was broken from inside... His suicide note also mentioned that his parents be given custody of his child,” - Pawan Kumar, father of Atul Subhash.

This case highlights the serious issues surrounding domestic violence and mental health, prompting public discussion on the responsibilities of family members in such scenarios.

title: Kejriwal promises to waive 'inflated' water bills, if AAP wins Delhi polls - The Times of India
summary:
Kejriwal Promises to Waive 'Inflated' Water Bills If AAP Wins Delhi Polls

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has vowed to waive off what he calls 'inflated' water bills if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) retains power in the upcoming elections. This promise is part of the party's campaign strategy aimed at addressing the grievances of Delhi residents regarding high water charges.

  • Kejriwal's assurance targets the issue of inflated water bills in Delhi.
  • The waiver proposal is positioned as a key aspect of AAP's electoral campaign.
  • The party aims to garner support from voters affected by rising utility costs.
“If AAP wins, we will cancel all unnecessary water charges and ensure that residents pay only for the actual water consumed,” stated Kejriwal.

The AAP aims to strengthen its hold in the Delhi assembly by emphasizing issues of utility affordability and civic welfare.

title: Delhi polls: Arvind Kejriwal alleges ‘covert, behind-the-scenes’ alliance between BJP, Congress - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Accuses BJP and Congress of Secret Alliance Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Arvind Kejriwal, the national convenor of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), has accused the BJP and Congress of maintaining a covert alliance ahead of the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, amidst strained relations between AAP and Congress.

  • Kejriwal calls for BJP and Congress to officially announce their alliance.
  • The relationship between AAP and Congress has soured after failed coalition attempts in the Haryana elections.
  • Protests occurred outside Kejriwal’s residence over delayed financial promises to women in Punjab.
  • Kejriwal alleges the protesting women were sent by BJP and Congress.
  • Controversy arises over the financial aid promise to women as the Mahila Samman Yojana is under investigation.
“The Congress and the BJP should officially declare that they are contesting the elections against AAP in an alliance. This covert, behind-the-scenes collaboration is unacceptable.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The allegations and subsequent protests highlight the contentious political atmosphere in Delhi as elections approach, with Kejriwal emphasizing the need for transparency in party alliances.
newTitle: Kejriwal Accuses BJP and Congress of Secret Alliance Ahead of Delhi Elections

title: Delhi: Class 9 student stabbed to death after fight with schoolmate over ball hit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Fatal Stabbing Outside Delhi School: 14-Year-Old Dies After Fight with Classmate

Date & Source: Jan 04, 2025 08:54 PM IST, HT News Desk, Hindustan Times

In a tragic incident, a 14-year-old boy identified as Ishu Gupta was stabbed to death outside the Rajkiya Sarvodaya Bal Vidyalaya in Shakarpur, Delhi after a fight with a classmate. The altercation started over a ball hit during a break at school.

The classmate, enraged after being hit by the ball, borrowed a mobile phone and made a call, discussing a dispute with the victim and instructing the person on the line to 'send people'. Later, as students left the school, the accused classmate was seen waiting outside with a group, including an accomplice who stabbed the victim in his right thigh, causing severe injuries.

The victim was rushed to the hospital but succumbed to his injuries. Seven suspects, including five juveniles, a 19-year-old college student, and a 31-year-old dairy shop owner, were apprehended, and the knife used in the murder was recovered.
newTitle: Fatal Stabbing Outside Delhi School: 14-Year-Old Dies After Fight with Classmate

title: When Chhattisgarh Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar Helped In Release Of Abducted CRPF Jawan - News18
summary:
Chhattisgarh Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar's Role in the Release of Abducted CRPF Jawan

Published on: January 04, 2025, Source: News18

Mukesh Chandrakar, a journalist in Chhattisgarh, was instrumental in the release of CRPF commando Rakeshwar Singh Manhas, who was abducted by Maoists during an encounter in 2021.

  • Mukesh Chandrakar’s efforts were recognized by the state police for securing the release of the abducted CRPF personnel.
  • Chandrakar was also known for his investigative reporting on corruption in the Bastar region.
  • He was found dead in a water tank on January 4, 2025, after going missing since January 1.
  • His disappearance followed an investigation into alleged irregularities in a ₹120-crore road construction project.
“The victim’s brother informed us yesterday that Mukesh had been missing since January 1. We initiated action, scanned CCTV footage, and also found his last location. We found Mukesh’s dead body inside a tank in the evening today.”

The life and work of Mukesh Chandrakar highlight the risks journalists face while reporting in conflict zones and their commitment to uncovering the truth.
newTitle: Chhattisgarh Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar's Role in the Release of Abducted CRPF Jawan

Tamil Nadu govt. declares holiday on January 17 - The Hindu
summary:
Tamil Nadu Government Declares Holiday on January 17 for Pongal Celebrations

Publication Date: January 4, 2025 Source: The Hindu

On January 4, 2025, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced a holiday on January 17, 2025, for government offices, public sector undertakings, schools, and colleges across the state in light of the Pongal festival.

  • The Pongal festival is celebrated on January 15, with holidays on the 16th, 18th, and 19th.
  • The decision to declare January 17 as a holiday was made following requests from government employees and students who will be traveling to their native places to celebrate the festival.
"As a lot of government employees and students will go to their native places to celebrate Pongal, there was a request to declare a holiday on January 17 as well. The government has considered their request and declared a holiday on January 17," said Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

This decision reflects the government's responsiveness to the cultural significance of Pongal and the needs of its citizens.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu Government Declares Holiday on January 17 for Pongal Celebrations

title: MLA Uma Thomas accident: Kerala court grants interim bail to accused event organizer - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala Court Grants Interim Bail to Event Organizer Accused in MLA Uma Thomas Accident

Publication Date: January 2, 2025

Source: Bar & Bench

The trial court granted interim bail to Nigosh Kumar, accused of causing severe injuries to MLA Uma Thomas during a large public event.

  • The incident occurred on December 29, 2024, at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium during a record-setting Bharatanatyam performance.
  • Thomas fell 15 feet while attempting to take her seat in the VIP section, resulting in critical injuries.
  • Event organizers faced allegations of inadequate safety measures.
  • Kumar and another accused initially sought anticipatory bail from the Kerala High Court but were required to surrender to the police.
  • Kumar was formally arrested on January 2, 2025.
  • His counsel argued he was falsely implicated and that there was no intent to harm.
  • The magistrate granted interim bail until January 7, 2025, after considering the defense's arguments.
“The allegations of negligence regarding the construction of pathways and barricades for VIP seating did not justify invoking Section 110 of the BNS.”

This case highlights significant concerns regarding public event safety and organizer accountability.
newTitle: Kerala Court Grants Interim Bail to Event Organizer Accused in MLA Uma Thomas Accident

title: Starting Tomorrow, You Can Travel From Delhi To Meerut In Less Than 40 Minutes For Just Rs 150 - News18
summary:
Delhi to Meerut Commute Under 40 Minutes for Just Rs 150 Starting Tomorrow

Publication Date: January 04, 2025 Source: News18

The Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS), also known as Namo Bharat trains, will be available to the public starting Sunday evening, offering a significantly reduced travel time from Delhi to Meerut.

  • The travel time from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South is under 40 minutes.
  • Standard coach fare is Rs 150, while premium coach fare is Rs 225.
  • Namo Bharat trains will operate every 15 minutes.
  • The inauguration is scheduled for January 5 by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • Total operational stretch will expand to 55 kilometers with 11 stations.
“These projects will not only reduce travel time but also accelerate regional economic growth,” said Delhi Chief Minister Atishi.

This new transit option is poised to enhance connectivity between Delhi and Meerut, promoting smoother regional commuting.
newTitle: Delhi to Meerut Commute Under 40 Minutes for Just Rs 150 Starting Tomorrow

title: CISF jawan kills himself with service weapon at Surat International airport - The Hindu
summary:
CISF Jawan Dies by Suicide at Surat International Airport

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: The Hindu

A 32-year-old jawan from the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) committed suicide at Surat International Airport by shooting himself with his service weapon. The incident occurred on January 4, 2025, around 2:10 PM.

  • The deceased, identified as Kisan Singh, was from Jaipur and was on duty at the airport.
  • Police reported that he died in a washroom and was pronounced dead shortly after being taken to a hospital.
  • The motive behind the suicide is currently unknown and is under investigation.
The reason for the extreme step taken by the jawan was not immediately clear.

This tragic event raises concerns regarding the mental health and well-being of personnel in high-stress roles.

title: Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
summary:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has indicated a distant approach from the ongoing farmers' protests led by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha, unlike the proactive measures taken during Modi's previous term.

  • Farmers have been protesting since February 2024 at the Punjab-Haryana borders, demanding legal status for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and a farm debt waiver.
  • Chouhan has extended an open invitation for talks, yet has not engaged directly with the protesting farmers.
  • The government's previous attempts to resolve farmer grievances, particularly in 2020-21, led to escalated tensions and prolonged protests.
  • Current protests are more localized and lack the broad unity seen in earlier movements.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, president of BKU Sidhupur, is on a hunger strike demanding response to farmers' issues from the government.
“Currently, the Supreme Court is looking into this issue. Whatever directives the Supreme Court gives, will be followed.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

This current strategy marks a significant shift in the government's handling of farmer-related issues, emphasizing a more detached stance in contrast to previous direct engagements.
newTitle: Modi Government's Distance from Farmers' Protests Explained

Life sprouts in space: Isro successfully germinates cowpea seeds in just four days under microgravity con - The Times of India
summary:
Life sprouts in space: Isro successfully germinates cowpea seeds in just four days under microgravity conditions

Published on: [Insert Date] Source: Times of India

Isro has made a significant breakthrough by germinating cowpea seeds in microgravity conditions during their PSLV-C60 POEM-4 mission.

  • The experiment used the Compact Research Module for Orbital Plant Studies (CROPS).
  • CROPS was developed to research seed germination in space.
  • Eight cowpea seeds were placed in a regulated environment with precise temperature control.
  • The germination occurred in just four days, with further leaf development expected.
  • This experiment lays the groundwork for future agricultural studies in space.
  • The mission included 24 sophisticated payloads developed in collaboration with academic institutions.
This development presents significant potential for future space expeditions, particularly for extended missions and establishing human settlements on other celestial bodies.

The success of this initiative is a major step towards sustainable space agriculture, crucial for life on future space missions.
newTitle: Isro Successfully Germinates Cowpea Seeds in Space

title: 3 Soldiers Die As Army Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In Jammu And Kashmir - NDTV
summary:
Three Soldiers Die in Army Vehicle Accident in Jammu and Kashmir

Date: Saturday Source: Srinagar

Three soldiers died after an Army truck skidded off the road and plunged into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district. Bad weather contributed to the accident.

  • Incident occurred near the SK Payen area at around 2.30 pm.
  • The Army expressed gratitude towards Kashmiri locals for their assistance in evacuating injured soldiers.
  • Heartfelt condolences were offered to the bereaved families by the Army.
  • This incident follows another vehicle accident last month in which five soldiers died.
“Tragically three bravehearts lost their lives in the unfortunate accident. Indian Army extends heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families.”

The tragic loss of these soldiers highlights the dangers faced by military personnel in challenging weather conditions.

title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
Who was R Chidambaram, scientist involved in 1974 'Op Smiling Buddha', Pokhran tests? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who was R Chidambaram, scientist involved in 1974 'Op Smiling Buddha', Pokhran tests?

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Rajagopala Chidambaram, a prominent physicist and leader in India's nuclear program, passed away at age 88 on January 4, 2025. He is celebrated for his roles in both the 1974 'Smiling Buddha' and the 1998 Pokhran-II tests, which confirmed India's status as a nuclear power.

  • Chidambaram served as Principal Scientific Adviser (2001–2018) and director of Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (1990-1993).
  • His contributions helped advance India's nuclear capabilities and scientific research, impacting sectors like energy and healthcare.
  • He was recognised with honors such as the Padma Shri (1975) and Padma Vibhushan (1999) for his work.
  • Chidambaram's research greatly influenced materials science and high-pressure physics in India.
“His unparalleled contributions to India's scientific and strategic capabilities and his visionary leadership in science and technology will forever be remembered.” - Department of Atomic Energy

R. Chidambaram's legacy is marked by his dedication to scientific excellence and national progress in nuclear technology.
newTitle: Remembering R. Chidambaram: Key Figure in India's Nuclear Journey

title: Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted - Hindustan Times
summary:
Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted

Date: January 4, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Flight and train operations have been severely impacted in Delhi due to dense fog, leading to flight diversions and delays.

  • Normal operations have resumed at Delhi airport after interruptions.
  • A total of 19 flights were diverted due to adverse weather conditions early Saturday.
  • IndiGo and Air India reported temporary halts in operations due to extremely low visibility.
  • 81 trains were delayed at New Delhi station also owing to the fog.
  • Cold wave conditions affected several regions, including Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan.
“Due to adverse weather conditions in Delhi, 19 flight diversions were reported between 0015 hours and 0130 hours. Operations have now returned to normal.” - Delhi International Airport Limited

The recovery of operations signifies a return to normalcy at Delhi airport, but the impact of the weather has disrupted travel significantly.
newTitle: Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted

Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized that the Indian government's initiatives are energizing rural India, aiming to empower communities and transform villages into hubs of growth.

title: S.354 IPC | To Establish Mens Rea, Something More Than Vague Statements Must Be Produced : Supreme Court... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Emphasizes Clarity in Establishing Mens Rea for IPC Section 354

Date: January 02, 2025
Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has ruled that for Section 354 IPC to apply, there must be a clear demonstration of criminal force along with intent to outrage a woman’s modesty. Vague statements are insufficient to establish mens rea.

  • The court found that mere assertions of discomfort do not meet the legal requirements for establishing mens rea.
  • In this case, the complaint against the appellant was quashed due to lack of substantial evidence.
  • The court underscored that definitions of criminal force exist, but modesty lacks a clear legal definition.
  • Citing precedents, the court stressed the necessity of intention to support allegations of criminal intimidation.
  • The proceedings against the appellant were set aside, reflecting on the misuse of legal processes.
“To establish mens rea, something better than vague statements must be produced before the court.”

The ruling highlights the need for clear evidence in legal cases related to IPC Section 354, reinforcing the principle that any claims must be substantiated beyond mere assertions.
newTitle: Supreme Court Emphasizes Clarity in Establishing Mens Rea for IPC Section 354

title: Pani Puri Vendor Served GST Notice Over Rs 40 Lakh UPI Receipts in a Year - Times Now
summary:
Pani Puri Vendor Served GST Notice Over Rs 40 Lakh UPI Receipts in a Year

Publication Date: December 17, 2024

Source: Times Now

A Pani Puri seller in Tamil Nadu has been served a Goods and Services Tax (GST) notice after receiving UPI payments worth over Rs. 40 lakh in a single year, reportedly without proper GST registration.

  • The vendor's UPI payments were tracked over three financial years.
  • He recorded a turnover of Rs. 40,11,019 in FY 2023-24, exceeding the GST registration threshold.
  • Suppliers exceeding the exemption threshold are liable for penalties under the TNGST Act if not registered.
  • The notice was issued on December 17, 2024, and a summons was sent to appear in person.
  • Concerns on social media about discouraging online payments for street food businesses.
  • The annual income noted was higher than average salaries for many professionals.
“Further, supplying goods/services without obtaining GST registration even after crossing the threshold limit is an offence, liable to be penalised under section 122(1)(xi) of the TNGST Act, 2017 that extends to Rs. 10,000 or 10% of the tax due, whichever is higher.”

This notice raises significant concerns regarding the treatment of small vendors in the increasingly digital economy.
newTitle: Pani Puri Vendor Served GST Notice Over Rs 40 Lakh UPI Receipts in a Year

title: Army vehicle falls into gorge in J&K's Bandipora, 3 soldiers dead - Hindustan Times
summary:
Army Vehicle Accident in Bandipora Claims Lives of Three Soldiers

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

At least three soldiers died and two others were injured after an Army vehicle skidded off the road in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district and fell into a deep gorge near the Wular Viewpoint on Saturday.

  • The Indian Army's Chinar Corps cited inclement weather and poor visibility as causes for the accident.
  • Rescue operations were aided by Kashmiri locals, thanking them for their swift assistance.
  • Three soldiers are reported in critical condition, while two were declared dead upon arrival at the hospital.
  • This incident follows a similar accident where five soldiers were killed a week prior in Poonch district.
  • Weather warnings are in place, including yellow and orange alerts for snowfall affecting travel and safety.
"Tragically three bravehearts lost their lives in the unfortunate accident. Indian Army extends heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families."

The incident highlights ongoing safety concerns for military operations in adverse weather conditions and the need for caution amongst civilians as forecasts predict heavy snowfall.
newTitle: Army Vehicle Accident in Bandipora Claims Lives of Three Soldiers
